channel.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

item.title: [SBG3][Network] - Network equipment version reload S356B01
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Dec 3, 00:00 - 01:00 UTC

Nov 20, 02:57 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Baremetal offer.

Start time : 03/12/2024 00:00 UTC
End time : 03/12/2024 01:00 UTC
Service impact : Network bandwidth reduction for customers with LACP (Link Aggregation Control Protocol) activated.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will have to carry out interventions on a network equipment.

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [ERI][Dedicated Servers] - Rack ERI0111D04B
item.description:
Nov 21, 11:38 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 21/11/2024 10:53 UTC
End time : 21/11/2024 11:17 UTC
Root cause : This incident was due to a cooling system issue.
We would like to inform you that the incident have been resolved and the situation is back to normal.
All services are operational.

We thank you for your understanding and patience throughout this incident

Nov 21, 10:48 UTC
Update - A significant number of servers in the rack ERI0111D04B are available.
Our teams are fully mobilized and we will keep you informed of developments and the resolution of the incident.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

Nov 21, 10:19 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Nov 21, 10:07 UTC
Investigating - An incident is in progress on our Bare Metal offer. It has temporarily affected the Availability.

Our teams are fully mobilized and actively working to resolve this problem.

We will keep you informed of developments and the resolution of the incident.

We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your understanding.

Here is detail for this incident :

Start time : 21/11/2024 10:53 UTC
Service impact : All of servers in the rack ERI0111D04B are no longer responding.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

item.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - Degradation in the performance of order servers
item.description:
Nov 20, 15:17 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 19/11/2024 22:09 UTC
End time : 20/11/2024 01:25 UTC
Root cause : It was due to an update on a software. We have reverted to an earlier version.

We would like to inform you that the incident have been resolved and the situation is back to normal.

We thank you for your understanding and patience throughout this incident

Nov 20, 01:45 UTC
Monitoring - We are pleased to inform you that the issue impacting your service has been resolved since 20/11/2024 01:25 UTC.
Thank you for your patience as our technical teams worked to find a solution.
We will continue to monitor the situation to ensure that everything stays running smoothly.

Nov 20, 01:00 UTC
Update - We are currently investigating the issue and our technical team is working assiduously to implement a solution.
We will provide an update as soon as we have made sufficient progress.

Nov 20, 00:28 UTC

We will provide an update as soon as we have made progress.

Nov 19, 22:50 UTC

Please be aware that this is currently affecting the availability.

Here is detail for this incident :

Start time : 19/11/2024 22:09 UTC
Service impact : We regret to inform you that customers may currently experience a degradation in the performance of order servers.
Ongoing actions : Investigating

Our teams are fully mobilized and we will keep you informed of developments and the resolution of the incident.

We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [RBX8][Enterprise File Storage] Service down
item.description:
Nov 19, 16:33 UTC
Resolved - An incident is in progress on our Enterprise File Storage Offer

Please be aware that this is currently affecting the availability.

Here is detail for this incident :

Start time : 19/11/2024 15:39 UTC
End time : 19/11/2024 16:00 UTC
Service impact : The NFS service experienced an unvailability, impacting Enterprise File Storage customers who may have faced disruption in accessing their data during this time.
Root cause : https://bare-metal-servers.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/0lcsqwrwgggz
Ongoing actions : We would like to inform you that the incident have been resolved and the situation is back to normal.

Our teams are fully mobilized and we will keep you informed of developments and the resolution of the incident.

We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your understanding.
